required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of an Aromatic Botanical Extract on Respiratory Health.
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of an Aromatic Botanical Extract on Respiratory Health.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized, double blind, placebo controlled, intervention study evaluating the effect of an aromatic botanical extract on overall respiratory health among otherwise healthy adults.

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed about the study and providing informed consent, patients with respiratory complaints will be randomized into a double blind placebo controlled trial of the botanical extract.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are recruited through a single health practice and randomized through block randomization to one of 2 groups: botanical extract or inert control.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on the 44-part Wisconsin Upper Respiratory Symptom Survey (WURSS-44) at day 3.
primary_outcome.description: The Wisconsin Upper Respiratory Symptom Survey (WURSS-44) is a validated, self reported instrument assessing overall respiratory health. Possible scores range from 0 to 308 with lower scores indicating fewer respiratory complaints.

arm_group.description: Participants receive the aromatic botanical extract orally every 4-6 waking hours for 3 days.
Participants receive the placebo matching the botanical extract orally every 4-6 waking hours for 3 days.

intervention.description: Combination blend of aromatic plant extracts in an emulsifier carrier.
Emulsifier carrier without active supplement ingredients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age: 18-60 years
- currently experiencing respiratory symptoms
- otherwise healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- underlying respiratory conditions
- pregnant, breastfeeding, or trying to conceive
- tobacco use in the home
- allergies to any of the ingredients

facility.name: Franklin School of Integrative Health Sciences
